intro: Heteropterys pallida, commonly known as the pale heteropterys, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
